1811       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = JsonSerializer
1812       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
1813       *       .disableIgnoreTransientFields()
1814       *       .build();
1815       *
1816       *    <jc>// Produces:  {"foo":"foo"}</jc>
1817       *    String <jv>json</jv> = <jv>serializer</jv>.serialize(<jk>new</jk> MyBean());
1818       * </p>
1819       *
1820       * <ul class='notes'>
1821       *    <li class='note'>The {@link Beanp @Beanp} annotation can also be used on transient fields to keep them from being ignored.
1822       * </ul>
1823       *
1824       * <ul class='seealso'>
1825       *    <li class='ja'>{@link BeanConfig#disableIgnoreTransientFields()}
1826       *    <li class='jm'>{@link BeanContext.Builder#disableIgnoreTransientFields()}
1827       * </ul>
1828       *
1829       * @return This object.
1830       */
1831      @FluentSetter
1832      public Builder disableIgnoreTransientFields() {
1833         bcBuilder.disableIgnoreTransientFields();
1834         return this;
1835      }
1836
1837      /**
1838       * Ignore unknown properties.
1839       *
1840       * <p>
1841       * When enabled, trying to set a value on a non-existent bean property will silently be ignored.
1842       * Otherwise, a {@code BeanRuntimeException} is thrown.
1843       *
1844       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
1845       * <p class='bjava'>
1846       *    <jc>// A bean with a single property.</jc>
1847       *    <jk>public class</jk> MyBean {
1848       *       <jk>public</jk> String <jf>foo</jf>;
1849       *    }
1850       *
1851       *    <jc>// Create a parser that ignores missing bean properties.</jc>
1852       *    ReaderParser <jv>parser</jv> = JsonParser
1853       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
1854       *       .ignoreUnknownBeanProperties()
1855       *       .build();
1856       *
1857       *    <jc>// Doesn't throw an exception on unknown 'bar' property.</jc>
1858       *    MyBean <jv>bean</jv> = <jv>parser</jv>.parse(<js>"{foo:'foo',bar:'bar'}"</js>, MyBean.<jk>class</jk>);
1859       * </p>
1860       *
1861       * <ul class='seealso'>
1862       *    <li class='ja'>{@link BeanConfig#ignoreUnknownBeanProperties()}
1863       *    <li class='jm'>{@link BeanContext.Builder#ignoreUnknownBeanProperties()}
1864       * </ul>
1865       *
1866       * @return This object.
1867       */
1868      @FluentSetter
1869      public Builder ignoreUnknownBeanProperties() {
1870         bcBuilder.ignoreUnknownBeanProperties();
1871         return this;
1872      }
1873
1874      /**
1875       * Ignore unknown enum values.
1876       *
1877       * <p>
1878       * When enabled, unknown enum values are set to <jk>null</jk> instead of throwing a parse exception.
1879       *
1880       * <ul class='seealso'>
1881       *    <li class='ja'>{@link BeanConfig#ignoreUnknownEnumValues()}
1882       *    <li class='jm'>{@link BeanContext.Builder#ignoreUnknownEnumValues()}
1883       * </ul>
1884       *
1885       * @return This object.
1886       */
1887      @FluentSetter
1888      public Builder ignoreUnknownEnumValues() {
1889         bcBuilder.ignoreUnknownEnumValues();
1890         return this;
1891      }
1892
1893      /**
1894       * Don't ignore unknown properties with null values.
1895       *
1896       * <p>
1897       * When enabled, trying to set a <jk>null</jk> value on a non-existent bean property will throw a {@link BeanRuntimeException}.
1898       * Otherwise it will be silently ignored.
1899       *
1900       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
1901       * <p class='bjava'>
1902       *    <jc>// A bean with a single property.</jc>
1903       *    <jk>public class</jk> MyBean {
1904       *       <jk>public</jk> String <jf>foo</jf>;
1905       *    }
1906       *
1907       *    <jc>// Create a parser that throws an exception on an unknown property even if the value being set is null.</jc>
1908       *    ReaderParser <jv>parser</jv> = JsonParser
1909       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
1910       *       .disableIgnoreUnknownNullBeanProperties()
1911       *       .build();
1912       *
1913       *    <jc>// Throws a BeanRuntimeException wrapped in a ParseException on the unknown 'bar' property.</jc>
1914       *    MyBean <jv>bean</jv> = <jv>parser</jv>.parse(<js>"{foo:'foo',bar:null}"</js>, MyBean.<jk>class</jk>);
1915       * </p>
1916       *
1917       * <ul class='seealso'>
1918       *    <li class='ja'>{@link BeanConfig#disableIgnoreUnknownNullBeanProperties()}
1919       *    <li class='jm'>{@link BeanContext.Builder#disableIgnoreUnknownNullBeanProperties()}
1920       * </ul>
1921       *
1922       * @return This object.
1923       */
1924      @FluentSetter
1925      public Builder disableIgnoreUnknownNullBeanProperties() {
1926         bcBuilder.disableIgnoreUnknownNullBeanProperties();
1927         return this;
1928      }
1929
1930      /**
1931       * Implementation classes.
1932       *
1933       * <p>
1934       * For interfaces and abstract classes this method can be used to specify an implementation class for the
1935       * interface/abstract class so that instances of the implementation class are used when instantiated (e.g. during a
1936       * parse).
1937       *
1938       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
1939       * <p class='bjava'>
1940       *    <jc>// A bean interface.</jc>
1941       *    <jk>public interface</jk> MyBean {
1942       *       ...
1943       *    }
1944       *
1945       *    <jc>// A bean implementation.</jc>
1946       *    <jk>public class</jk> MyBeanImpl <jk>implements</jk> MyBean {
1947       *       ...
1948       *    }
1949
1950       *    <jc>// Create a parser that instantiates MyBeanImpls when parsing MyBeans.</jc>
1951       *    ReaderParser <jv>parser</jv> = JsonParser
1952       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
1953       *       .implClass(MyBean.<jk>class</jk>, MyBeanImpl.<jk>class</jk>)
1954       *       .build();
1955       *
1956       *    <jc>// Instantiates a MyBeanImpl,</jc>
1957       *    MyBean <jv>bean</jv> = <jv>parser</jv>.parse(<js>"..."</js>, MyBean.<jk>class</jk>);
1958       * </p>
1959       *
1960       * @param interfaceClass The interface class.
1961       * @param implClass The implementation class.
1962       * @return This object.
1963       */
1964      @FluentSetter
1965      public Builder implClass(Class<?> interfaceClass, Class<?> implClass) {
1966         bcBuilder.implClass(interfaceClass, implClass);
1967         return this;
1968      }
1969
1970      /**
1971       * Implementation classes.
1972       *
1973       * <p>
1974       * For interfaces and abstract classes this method can be used to specify an implementation class for the
1975       * interface/abstract class so that instances of the implementation class are used when instantiated (e.g. during a
1976       * parse).
1977       *
1978       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
1979       * <p class='bjava'>
1980       *    <jc>// A bean with a single property.</jc>
1981       *    <jk>public interface</jk> MyBean {
1982       *       ...
1983       *    }
1984       *
1985       *    <jc>// A bean with a single property.</jc>
1986       *    <jk>public class</jk> MyBeanImpl <jk>implements</jk> MyBean {
1987       *       ...
1988       *    }
1989
1990       *    <jc>// Create a parser that instantiates MyBeanImpls when parsing MyBeans.</jc>
1991       *    ReaderParser <jv>parser</jv> = JsonParser
1992       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
1993       *       .implClasses(AMap.<jsm>of</jsm>(MyBean.<jk>class</jk>, MyBeanImpl.<jk>class</jk>))
1994       *       .build();
1995       *
1996       *    <jc>// Instantiates a MyBeanImpl,</jc>
1997       *    MyBean <jv>bean</jv> = <jv>parser</jv>.parse(<js>"..."</js>, MyBean.<jk>class</jk>);
1998       * </p>
1999       *
2000       * @param values
2001       *    The new value for this setting.
2002       * @return This object.
2003       */
2004      @FluentSetter
2005      public Builder implClasses(Map<Class<?>,Class<?>> values) {
2006         bcBuilder.implClasses(values);
2007         return this;
2008      }
2009
2010      /**
2011       * Identifies a class to be used as the interface class for the specified class and all subclasses.
2012       *
2013       * <p>
2014       * When specified, only the list of properties defined on the interface class will be used during serialization.
2015       * Additional properties on subclasses will be ignored.
2016       *
2017       * <p class='bjava'>
2018       *    <jc>// Parent class or interface</jc>
2019       *    <jk>public abstract class</jk> A {
2020       *       <jk>public</jk> String <jf>foo</jf> = <js>"foo"</js>;
2021       *    }
2022       *
2023       *    <jc>// Sub class</jc>
2024       *    <jk>public class</jk> A1 <jk>extends</jk> A {
2025       *       <jk>public</jk> String <jf>bar</jf> = <js>"bar"</js>;
2026       *    }
2027       *
2028       *    <jc>// Create a serializer and define our interface class mapping.</jc>
2029       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = JsonSerializer
2030       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
2031       *       .interfaceClass(A1.<jk>class</jk>, A.<jk>class</jk>)
2032       *       .build();
2033       *
2034       *    <jc>// Produces "{"foo":"foo"}"</jc>
2035       *    String <jv>json</jv> = <jv>serializer</jv>.serialize(<jk>new</jk> A1());
2036       * </p>
2037       *
2038       * <p>
2039       * This annotation can be used on the parent class so that it filters to all child classes, or can be set
2040       * individually on the child classes.
2041       *
2042       * <ul class='notes'>
2043       *    <li class='note'>The {@link Bean#interfaceClass() @Bean(interfaceClass)} annotation is the equivalent annotation-based solution.
2044       * </ul>
2045       *
2046       * @param on The class that the interface class applies to.
2047       * @param value
2048       *    The new value for this setting.
2049       * @return This object.
2050       */
2051      @FluentSetter
2052      public Builder interfaceClass(Class<?> on, Class<?> value) {
2053         bcBuilder.interfaceClass(on, value);
2054         return this;
2055      }
2056
2057      /**
2058       * Identifies a set of interfaces.
2059       *
2060       * <p>
2061       * When specified, only the list of properties defined on the interface class will be used during serialization
2062       * of implementation classes.  Additional properties on subclasses will be ignored.
2063       *
2064       * <p class='bjava'>
2065       *    <jc>// Parent class or interface</jc>
2066       *    <jk>public abstract class</jk> A {
2067       *       <jk>public</jk> String <jf>foo</jf> = <js>"foo"</js>;
2068       *    }
2069       *
2070       *    <jc>// Sub class</jc>
2071       *    <jk>public class</jk> A1 <jk>extends</jk> A {
2072       *       <jk>public</jk> String <jf>bar</jf> = <js>"bar"</js>;
2073       *    }
2074       *
2075       *    <jc>// Create a serializer and define our interface class mapping.</jc>
2076       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = JsonSerializer
2077       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
2078       *       .interfaces(A.<jk>class</jk>)
2079       *       .build();
2080       *
2081       *    <jc>// Produces "{"foo":"foo"}"</jc>
2082       *    String <jv>json</jv> = <jv>serializer</jv>.serialize(<jk>new</jk> A1());
2083       * </p>
2084       *
2085       * <p>
2086       * This annotation can be used on the parent class so that it filters to all child classes, or can be set
2087       * individually on the child classes.
2088       *
2089       * <ul class='notes'>
2090       *    <li class='note'>The {@link Bean#interfaceClass() @Bean(interfaceClass)} annotation is the equivalent annotation-based solution.
2091       * </ul>
2092       *
2093       * @param value
2094       *    The new value for this setting.
2095       * @return This object.
2096       */
2097      @FluentSetter
2098      public Builder interfaces(Class<?>...value) {
2099         bcBuilder.interfaces(value);
2100         return this;
2101      }
2102
2103      /**
2104       * <i><l>Context</l> configuration property:&emsp;</i>  Locale.
2105       *
2106       * <p>
2107       * Specifies the default locale for serializer and parser sessions when not specified via {@link BeanSession.Builder#locale(Locale)}.
2108       * Typically used for POJO swaps that need to deal with locales such as swaps that convert <l>Date</l> and <l>Calendar</l>
2109       * objects to strings by accessing it via the session passed into the {@link ObjectSwap#swap(BeanSession, Object)} and
2110       * {@link ObjectSwap#unswap(BeanSession, Object, ClassMeta, String)} methods.
2111       *
2112       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
2113       * <p class='bjava'>
2114       *    <jc>// Define a POJO swap that skips serializing beans if we're in the UK.</jc>
2115       *    <jk>public class</jk> MyBeanSwap <jk>extends</jk> StringSwap&lt;MyBean&gt; {
2116       *       <ja>@Override</ja>
2117       *       <jk>public</jk> String swap(BeanSession <jv>session</jv>, MyBean <jv>bean</jv>) <jk>throws</jk> Exception {
2118       *          <jk>if</jk> (<jv>session</jv>.getLocale().equals(Locale.<jsf>UK</jsf>))
2119       *             <jk>return null</jk>;
2120       *          <jk>return</jk> <jv>bean</jv>.toString();
2121       *       }
2122       *    }
2123       *
2124       *    <jc>// Create a serializer that uses the specified locale if it's not passed in through session args.</jc>
2125       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = JsonSerializer
2126       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
2127       *       .locale(Locale.<jsf>UK</jsf>)
2128       *       .swaps(MyBeanSwap.<jk>class</jk>)
2129       *       .build();
2130       * </p>
2131       *
2132       * <ul class='seealso'>
2133       *    <li class='ja'>{@link BeanConfig#locale()}
2134       *    <li class='jm'>{@link BeanContext.Builder#locale(Locale)}
2135       *    <li class='jm'>{@link BeanSession.Builder#locale(Locale)}
2136       * </ul>
2137       *
2138       * @param value The new value for this property.
2139       * @return This object.
2140       */
2141      @FluentSetter
2142      public Builder locale(Locale value) {
2143         bcBuilder.locale(value);
2144         return this;
2145      }
2146
2147      /**
2148       * <i><l>Context</l> configuration property:&emsp;</i>  Media type.
2149       *
2150       * <p>
2151       * Specifies the default media type for serializer and parser sessions when not specified via {@link BeanSession.Builder#mediaType(MediaType)}.
2152       * Typically used for POJO swaps that need to serialize the same POJO classes differently depending on
2153       * the specific requested media type.   For example, a swap could handle a request for media types <js>"application/json"</js>
2154       * and <js>"application/json+foo"</js> slightly differently even though they're both being handled by the same JSON
2155       * serializer or parser.
2156       *
2157       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
2158       * <p class='bjava'>
2159       *    <jc>// Define a POJO swap that skips serializing beans if the media type is application/json.</jc>
2160       *    <jk>public class</jk> MyBeanSwap <jk>extends</jk> StringSwap&lt;MyBean&gt; {
2161       *       <ja>@Override</ja>
2162       *       <jk>public</jk> String swap(BeanSession <jv>session</jv>, MyBean <jv>bean</jv>) <jk>throws</jk> Exception {
2163       *          <jk>if</jk> (<jv>session</jv>.getMediaType().equals(<js>"application/json"</js>))
2164       *             <jk>return null</jk>;
2165       *          <jk>return</jk> <jv>bean</jv>.toString();
2166       *       }
2167       *    }
2168       *
2169       *    <jc>// Create a serializer that uses the specified media type if it's not passed in through session args.</jc>
2170       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = JsonSerializer
2171       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
2172       *       .mediaType(MediaType.<jsf>JSON</jsf>)
2173       *       .build();
2174       * </p>
2175       *
2176       * <ul class='seealso'>
2177       *    <li class='ja'>{@link BeanConfig#mediaType()}
2178       *    <li class='jm'>{@link BeanContext.Builder#mediaType(MediaType)}
2179       *    <li class='jm'>{@link BeanSession.Builder#mediaType(MediaType)}
2180       * </ul>
2181       *
2182       * @param value The new value for this property.
2183       * @return This object.
2184       */
2185      @FluentSetter
2186      public Builder mediaType(MediaType value) {
2187         bcBuilder.mediaType(value);
2188         return this;
2189      }
2190
2191      /**
2192       * Bean class exclusions.
2193       *
2194       * <p>
2195       * List of classes that should not be treated as beans even if they appear to be bean-like.
2196       * Not-bean classes are converted to <c>Strings</c> during serialization.
2197       *
2198       * <p>
2199       * Values can consist of any of the following types:
2200       * <ul>
2201       *    <li>Classes.
2202       *    <li>Arrays and collections of classes.
2203       * </ul>
2204       *
2205       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
2206       * <p class='bjava'>
2207       *    <jc>// A bean with a single property.</jc>
2208       *    <jk>public class</jk> MyBean {
2209       *       <jk>public</jk> String <jf>foo</jf> = <js>"bar"</js>;
2210       *
2211       *       <jk>public</jk> String toString() {
2212       *          <jk>return</jk> <js>"baz"</js>;
2213       *       }
2214       *    }
2215       *
2216       *    <jc>// Create a serializer that doesn't treat MyBean as a bean class.</jc>
2217       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = JsonSerializer
2218       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
2219       *       .notBeanClasses(MyBean.<jk>class</jk>)
2220       *       .build();
2221       *
2222       *    <jc>// Produces "baz" instead of {"foo":"bar"}</jc>
2223       *    String <jv>json</jv> = <jv>serializer</jv>.serialize(<jk>new</jk> MyBean());
2224       * </p>
2225       *
2226       * <ul class='notes'>
2227       *    <li class='note'>The {@link BeanIgnore @BeanIgnore} annotation can also be used on classes to prevent them from being recognized as beans.
2228       * </ul>
2229       *
2230       * <ul class='seealso'>
2231       *    <li class='ja'>{@link BeanIgnore}
2232       *    <li class='ja'>{@link BeanConfig#notBeanClasses()}
2233       *    <li class='jf'>{@link BeanContext.Builder#notBeanClasses()}
2234       * </ul>
2235       *
2236       * @param values
2237       *    The values to add to this setting.
2238       *    <br>Values can consist of any of the following types:
2239       *    <ul>
2240       *       <li>Classes.
2241       *       <li>Arrays and collections of classes.
2242       *    </ul>
2243       * @return This object.
2244       */
2245      @FluentSetter
2246      public Builder notBeanClasses(Class<?>...values) {
2247         bcBuilder.notBeanClasses(values);
2248         return this;
2249      }
2250
2251      /**
2252       * Bean package exclusions.
2253       *
2254       * <p>
2255       * Used as a convenient way of defining the {@link BeanContext.Builder#notBeanClasses(Class...)} property for entire packages.
2256       * Any classes within these packages will be serialized to strings using {@link Object#toString()}.
2257       *
2258       * <p>
2259       * Note that you can specify suffix patterns to include all subpackages.
2260       *
2261       * <p>
2262       * Values can consist of any of the following types:
2263       * <ul>
2264       *    <li>Strings.
2265       *    <li>Arrays and collections of strings.
2266       * </ul>
2267       *
2268       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
2269       * <p class='bjava'>
2270       *    <jc>// Create a serializer that ignores beans in the specified packages.</jc>
2271       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = JsonSerializer
2272       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
2273       *       .notBeanPackages(<js>"org.apache.foo"</js>, <js>"org.apache.bar.*"</js>)
2274       *       .build();
2275       * </p>
2276       *
2277       * <ul class='seealso'>
2278       *    <li class='jm'>{@link BeanContext.Builder#notBeanPackages(String...)}
2279       * </ul>
2280       *
2281       * @param values
2282       *    The values to add to this setting.
2283       *    <br>Values can consist of any of the following types:
2284       *    <ul>
2285       *       <li>{@link Package} objects.
2286       *       <li>Strings.
2287       *       <li>Arrays and collections of anything in this list.
2288       *    </ul>
2289       * @return This object.
2290       */
2291      @FluentSetter
2292      public Builder notBeanPackages(String...values) {
2293         bcBuilder.notBeanPackages(values);
2294         return this;
2295      }
2296
2297      /**
2298       * Bean property namer
2299       *
2300       * <p>
2301       * The class to use for calculating bean property names.
2302       *
2303       * <p>
2304       * Predefined classes:
2305       * <ul>
2306       *    <li>{@link BasicPropertyNamer} - Default.
2307       *    <li>{@link PropertyNamerDLC} - Dashed-lower-case names.
2308       *    <li>{@link PropertyNamerULC} - Dashed-upper-case names.
2309       * </ul>
2310       *
2311       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
2312       * <p class='bjava'>
2313       *    <jc>// A bean with a single property.</jc>
2314       *    <jk>public class</jk> MyBean {
2315       *       <jk>public</jk> String <jf>fooBarBaz</jf> = <js>"fooBarBaz"</js>;
2316       *    }
2317       *
2318       *    <jc>// Create a serializer that uses Dashed-Lower-Case property names.</jc>
2319       *    <jc>// (e.g. "foo-bar-baz" instead of "fooBarBaz")</jc>
2320       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = JsonSerializer
2321       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
2322       *       .propertyNamer(PropertyNamerDLC.<jk>class</jk>)
2323       *       .build();
2324       *
2325       *    <jc>// Produces:  {"foo-bar-baz":"fooBarBaz"}</jc>
2326       *    String <jv>json</jv> = <jv>serializer</jv>.serialize(<jk>new</jk> MyBean());
2327       * </p>
2328       *
2329       * <ul class='seealso'>
2330       *    <li class='jm'>{@link BeanContext.Builder#propertyNamer(Class)}
2331       * </ul>
2332       *
2333       * @param value
2334       *    The new value for this setting.
2335       *    <br>The default is {@link BasicPropertyNamer}.
2336       * @return This object.
2337       */
2338      @FluentSetter
2339      public Builder propertyNamer(Class<? extends PropertyNamer> value) {
2340         bcBuilder.propertyNamer(value);
2341         return this;
2342      }
2343
2344      /**
2345       * Bean property namer
2346       *
2347       * <p>
2348       * Same as {@link #propertyNamer(Class)} but allows you to specify a namer for a specific class.
2349       *
2350       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
2351       * <p class='bjava'>
2352       *    <jc>// A bean with a single property.</jc>
2353       *    <jk>public class</jk> MyBean {
2354       *       <jk>public</jk> String <jf>fooBarBaz</jf> = <js>"fooBarBaz"</js>;
2355       *    }
2356       *
2357       *    <jc>// Create a serializer that uses Dashed-Lower-Case property names for the MyBean class only.</jc>
2358       *    <jc>// (e.g. "foo-bar-baz" instead of "fooBarBaz")</jc>
2359       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = JsonSerializer
2360       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
2361       *       .propertyNamer(MyBean.<jk>class</jk>, PropertyNamerDLC.<jk>class</jk>)
2362       *       .build();
2363       *
2364       *    <jc>// Produces:  {"foo-bar-baz":"fooBarBaz"}</jc>
2365       *    String <jv>json</jv> = <jv>serializer</jv>.serialize(<jk>new</jk> MyBean());
2366       * </p>
2367       *
2368       * <ul class='seealso'>
2369       *    <li class='ja'>{@link Bean#propertyNamer() Bean(propertyNamer)}
2370       *    <li class='jm'>{@link BeanContext.Builder#propertyNamer(Class)}
2371       * </ul>
2372       *
2373       * @param on The class that the namer applies to.
2374       * @param value
2375       *    The new value for this setting.
2376       *    <br>The default is {@link BasicPropertyNamer}.
2377       * @return This object.
2378       */
2379      @FluentSetter
2380      public Builder propertyNamer(Class<?> on, Class<? extends PropertyNamer> value) {
2381         bcBuilder.propertyNamer(on, value);
2382         return this;
2383      }
2384
2385      /**
2386       * Sort bean properties.
2387       *
2388       * <p>
2389       * When enabled, all bean properties will be serialized and access in alphabetical order.
2390       * Otherwise, the natural order of the bean properties is used which is dependent on the JVM vendor.
2391       * On IBM JVMs, the bean properties are ordered based on their ordering in the Java file.
2392       * On Oracle JVMs, the bean properties are not ordered (which follows the official JVM specs).
2393       *
2394       * <p>
2395       * this setting is disabled by default so that IBM JVM users don't have to use {@link Bean @Bean} annotations
2396       * to force bean properties to be in a particular order and can just alter the order of the fields/methods
2397       * in the Java file.
2398       *
2399       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
2400       * <p class='bjava'>
2401       *    <jc>// A bean with 3 properties.</jc>
2402       *    <jk>public class</jk> MyBean {
2403       *       <jk>public</jk> String <jf>c</jf> = <js>"1"</js>;
2404       *       <jk>public</jk> String <jf>b</jf> = <js>"2"</js>;
2405       *       <jk>public</jk> String <jf>a</jf> = <js>"3"</js>;
2406       *    }
2407       *
2408       *    <jc>// Create a serializer that sorts bean properties.</jc>
2409       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = JsonSerializer
2410       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
2411       *       .sortProperties()
2412       *       .build();
2413       *
2414       *    <jc>// Produces:  {"a":"3","b":"2","c":"1"}</jc>
2415       *    String <jv>json</jv> = <jv>serializer</jv>.serialize(<jk>new</jk> MyBean());
2416       * </p>
2417       *
2418       * <ul class='notes'>
2419       *    <li class='note'>The {@link Bean#sort() @Bean.sort()} annotation can also be used to sort properties on just a single class.
2420       * </ul>
2421       *
2422       * <ul class='seealso'>
2423       *    <li class='jm'>{@link BeanContext.Builder#sortProperties()}
2424       * </ul>
2425       *
2426       * @return This object.
2427       */
2428      @FluentSetter
2429      public Builder sortProperties() {
2430         bcBuilder.sortProperties();
2431         return this;
2432      }
2433
2434      /**
2435       * Sort bean properties.
2436       *
2437       * <p>
2438       * Same as {@link #sortProperties()} but allows you to specify individual bean classes instead of globally.
2439       *
2440       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
2441       * <p class='bjava'>
2442       *    <jc>// A bean with 3 properties.</jc>
2443       *    <jk>public class</jk> MyBean {
2444       *       <jk>public</jk> String <jf>c</jf> = <js>"1"</js>;
2445       *       <jk>public</jk> String <jf>b</jf> = <js>"2"</js>;
2446       *       <jk>public</jk> String <jf>a</jf> = <js>"3"</js>;
2447       *    }
2448       *
2449       *    <jc>// Create a serializer that sorts properties on MyBean.</jc>
2450       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = JsonSerializer
2451       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
2452       *       .sortProperties(MyBean.<jk>class</jk>)
2453       *       .build();
2454       *
2455       *    <jc>// Produces:  {"a":"3","b":"2","c":"1"}</jc>
2456       *    String <jv>json</jv> = <jv>serializer</jv>.serialize(<jk>new</jk> MyBean());
2457       * </p>
2458       *
2459       * <ul class='seealso'>
2460       *    <li class='ja'>{@link Bean#sort() Bean(sort)}
2461       *    <li class='jm'>{@link BeanContext.Builder#sortProperties()}
2462       * </ul>
2463       *
2464       * @param on The bean classes to sort properties on.
2465       * @return This object.
2466       */
2467      @FluentSetter
2468      public Builder sortProperties(Class<?>...on) {
2469         bcBuilder.sortProperties(on);
2470         return this;
2471      }
2472
2473      /**
2474       * Identifies a stop class for the annotated class.
2475       *
2476       * <p>
2477       * Identical in purpose to the stop class specified by {@link Introspector#getBeanInfo(Class, Class)}.
2478       * Any properties in the stop class or in its base classes will be ignored during analysis.
2479       *
2480       * <p>
2481       * For example, in the following class hierarchy, instances of <c>C3</c> will include property <c>p3</c>,
2482       * but not <c>p1</c> or <c>p2</c>.
2483       *
2484       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
2485       * <p class='bjava'>
2486       *    <jk>public class</jk> C1 {
2487       *       <jk>public int</jk> getP1();
2488       *    }
2489       *
2490       *    <jk>public class</jk> C2 <jk>extends</jk> C1 {
2491       *       <jk>public int</jk> getP2();
2492       *    }
2493       *
2494       *    <jk>public class</jk> C3 <jk>extends</jk> C2 {
2495       *       <jk>public int</jk> getP3();
2496       *    }
2497       *
2498       *    <jc>// Create a serializer specifies a stop class for C3.</jc>
2499       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = JsonSerializer
2500       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
2501       *       .stopClass(C3.<jk>class</jk>, C2.<jk>class</jk>)
2502       *       .build();
2503       *
2504       *    <jc>// Produces:  {"p3":"..."}</jc>
2505       *    String <jv>json</jv> = <jv>serializer</jv>.serialize(<jk>new</jk> C3());
2506       * </p>
2507       *
2508       * @param on The class on which the stop class is being applied.
2509       * @param value
2510       *    The new value for this setting.
2511       * @return This object.
2512       */
2513      @FluentSetter
2514      public Builder stopClass(Class<?> on, Class<?> value) {
2515         bcBuilder.stopClass(on, value);
2516         return this;
2517      }
2518
2519      /**
2520       * Java object swaps.
2521       *
2522       * <p>
2523       * Swaps are used to "swap out" non-serializable classes with serializable equivalents during serialization,
2524       * and "swap in" the non-serializable class during parsing.
2525       *
2526       * <p>
2527       * An example of a swap would be a <c>Calendar</c> object that gets swapped out for an ISO8601 string.
2528       *
2529       * <p>
2530       * Multiple swaps can be associated with a single class.
2531       * When multiple swaps are applicable to the same class, the media type pattern defined by
2532       * {@link ObjectSwap#forMediaTypes()} or {@link Swap#mediaTypes() @Swap(mediaTypes)} are used to come up with the best match.
2533       *
2534       * <p>
2535       * Values can consist of any of the following types:
2536       * <ul>
2537       *    <li>Any subclass of {@link ObjectSwap}.
2538       *    <li>Any instance of {@link ObjectSwap}.
2539       *    <li>Any surrogate class.  A shortcut for defining a {@link SurrogateSwap}.
2540       *    <li>Any array or collection of the objects above.
2541       * </ul>
2542       *
2543       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
2544       * <p class='bjava'>
2545       *    <jc>// Sample swap for converting Dates to ISO8601 strings.</jc>
2546       *    <jk>public class</jk> MyDateSwap <jk>extends</jk> StringSwap&lt;Date&gt; {
2547       *       <jc>// ISO8601 formatter.</jc>
2548       *       <jk>private</jk> DateFormat <jf>format</jf> = <jk>new</jk> SimpleDateFormat(<js>"yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ"</js>);
2549       *
2550       *       <ja>@Override</ja>
2551       *       <jk>public</jk> String swap(BeanSession <jv>session</jv>, Date <jv>date</jv>) {
2552       *          <jk>return</jk> <jf>format</jf>.format(<jv>date</jv>);
2553       *       }
2554       *
2555       *       <ja>@Override</ja>
2556       *       <jk>public</jk> Date unswap(BeanSession <jv>session</jv>, String <jv>string</jv>, ClassMeta <jv>hint</jv>) <jk>throws</jk> Exception {
2557       *          <jk>return</jk> <jf>format</jf>.parse(<jv>string</jv>);
2558       *       }
2559       *    }
2560       *
2561       *    <jc>// Sample bean with a Date field.</jc>
2562       *    <jk>public class</jk> MyBean {
2563       *       <jk>public</jk> Date <jf>date</jf> = <jk>new</jk> Date(112, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6);
2564       *    }
2565       *
2566       *    <jc>// Create a serializer that uses our date swap.</jc>
2567       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = JsonSerializer
2568       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
2569       *       .swaps(MyDateSwap.<jk>class</jk>)
2570       *       .build();
2571       *
2572       *    <jc>// Produces:  {"date":"2012-03-03T04:05:06-0500"}</jc>
2573       *    String <jv>json</jv> = <jv>serializer</jv>.serialize(<jk>new</jk> MyBean());
2574       *
2575       *    <jc>// Create a serializer that uses our date swap.</jc>
2576       *    ReaderParser <jv>parser</jv> = JsonParser
2577       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
2578       *       .swaps(MyDateSwap.<jk>class</jk>)
2579       *       .build();
2580       *
2581       *    <jc>// Use our parser to parse a bean.</jc>
2582       *    MyBean <jv>bean</jv> = <jv>parser</jv>.parse(<jv>json</jv>, MyBean.<jk>class</jk>);
2583       * </p>
2584       *
2585       * <ul class='notes'>
2586       *    <li class='note'>The {@link Swap @Swap} annotation can also be used on classes to identify swaps for the class.
2587       *    <li class='note'>The {@link Swap @Swap} annotation can also be used on bean methods and fields to identify swaps for values of those bean properties.
2588       * </ul>
2589       *
2590       * <ul class='seealso'>
2591       *    <li class='jf'>{@link BeanContext.Builder#swaps(Class...)}
2592       * </ul>
2593       *
2594       * @param values
2595       *    The values to add to this setting.
2596       *    <br>Values can consist of any of the following types:
2597       *    <ul>
2598       *       <li>Any subclass of {@link ObjectSwap}.
2599       *       <li>Any surrogate class.  A shortcut for defining a {@link SurrogateSwap}.
2600       *       <li>Any array or collection of the objects above.
2601       *    </ul>
2602       * @return This object.
2603       */
2604      @FluentSetter
2605      public Builder swaps(Class<?>...values) {
2606         bcBuilder.swaps(values);
2607         return this;
2608      }
2609
2610      /**
2611       * A shortcut for defining a {@link FunctionalSwap}.
2612       *
2613       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
2614       * <p class='bjava'>
2615       *    <jc>// Create a serializer that performs a custom format for Date objects.</jc>
2616       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = JsonSerializer
2617       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
2618       *       .swap(Date.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>, <jv>x</jv> -&gt; <jsm>format</jsm>(<jv>x</jv>))
2619       *       .build();
2620       * </p>
2621       *
2622       * @param <T> The object type being swapped out.
2623       * @param <S> The object type being swapped in.
2624       * @param normalClass The object type being swapped out.
2625       * @param swappedClass The object type being swapped in.
2626       * @param swapFunction The function to convert the object.
2627       * @return This object.
2628       */
2629      @FluentSetter
2630      public <T,S> Builder swap(Class<T> normalClass, Class<S> swappedClass, ThrowingFunction<T,S> swapFunction) {
2631         bcBuilder.swap(normalClass, swappedClass, swapFunction);
2632         return this;
2633      }
2634
2635      /**
2636       * A shortcut for defining a {@link FunctionalSwap}.
2637       *
2638       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
2639       * <p class='bjava'>
2640       *    <jc>// Create a serializer that performs a custom format for Date objects.</jc>
2641       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = JsonSerializer
2642       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
2643       *       .swap(Date.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>, <jv>x</jv> -&gt; <jsm>format</jsm>(<jv>x</jv>), <jv>x</jv> -&gt; <jsm>parse</jsm>(<jv>x</jv>))
2644       *       .build();
2645       * </p>
2646       *
2647       * @param <T> The object type being swapped out.
2648       * @param <S> The object type being swapped in.
2649       * @param normalClass The object type being swapped out.
2650       * @param swappedClass The object type being swapped in.
2651       * @param swapFunction The function to convert the object during serialization.
2652       * @param unswapFunction The function to convert the object during parsing.
2653       * @return This object.
2654       */
2655      @FluentSetter
2656      public <T,S> Builder swap(Class<T> normalClass, Class<S> swappedClass, ThrowingFunction<T,S> swapFunction, ThrowingFunction<S,T> unswapFunction) {
2657         bcBuilder.swap(normalClass, swappedClass, swapFunction, unswapFunction);
2658         return this;
2659      }
2660
2661      /**
2662       * <i><l>Context</l> configuration property:&emsp;</i>  TimeZone.
2663       *
2664       * <p>
2665       * Specifies the default time zone for serializer and parser sessions when not specified via {@link BeanSession.Builder#timeZone(TimeZone)}.
2666       * Typically used for POJO swaps that need to deal with timezones such as swaps that convert <l>Date</l> and <l>Calendar</l>
2667       * objects to strings by accessing it via the session passed into the {@link ObjectSwap#swap(BeanSession, Object)} and
2668       * {@link ObjectSwap#unswap(BeanSession, Object, ClassMeta, String)} methods.
2669       *
2670       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
2671       * <p class='bjava'>
2672       *    <jc>// Define a POJO swap that skips serializing beans if the time zone is GMT.</jc>
2673       *    <jk>public class</jk> MyBeanSwap <jk>extends</jk> StringSwap&lt;MyBean&gt; {
2674       *       <ja>@Override</ja>
2675       *       <jk>public</jk> String swap(BeanSession <jv>session</jv>, MyBean <jv>bean</jv>) <jk>throws</jk> Exception {
2676       *          <jk>if</jk> (<jv>session</jv>.getTimeZone().equals(TimeZone.<jsf>GMT</jsf>))
2677       *             <jk>return null</jk>;
2678       *          <jk>return</jk> <jv>bean</jv>.toString();
2679       *       }
2680       *    }
2681       *
2682       *    <jc>// Create a serializer that uses GMT if the timezone is not specified in the session args.</jc>
2683       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = JsonSerializer
2684       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
2685       *       .timeZone(TimeZone.<jsf>GMT</jsf>)
2686       *       .build();
2687       * </p>
2688       *
2689       * <ul class='seealso'>
2690       *    <li class='ja'>{@link BeanConfig#timeZone()}
2691       *    <li class='jm'>{@link BeanContext.Builder#timeZone(TimeZone)}
2692       *    <li class='jm'>{@link BeanSession.Builder#timeZone(TimeZone)}
2693       * </ul>
2694       *
2695       * @param value The new value for this property.
2696       * @return This object.
2697       */
2698      @FluentSetter
2699      public Builder timeZone(TimeZone value) {
2700         bcBuilder.timeZone(value);
2701         return this;
2702      }
2703
2704      /**
2705       * An identifying name for this class.
2706       *
2707       * <p>
2708       * The name is used to identify the class type during parsing when it cannot be inferred through reflection.
2709       * For example, if a bean property is of type <c>Object</c>, then the serializer will add the name to the
2710       * output so that the class can be determined during parsing.
2711       *
2712       * <p>
2713       * It is also used to specify element names in XML.
2714       *
2715       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
2716       * <p class='bjava'>
2717       *    <jc>// Use _type='mybean' to identify this bean.</jc>
2718       *    <jk>public class</jk> MyBean {...}
2719       *
2720       *    <jc>// Create a serializer and specify the type name..</jc>
2721       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = JsonSerializer
2722       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
2723       *       .typeName(MyBean.<jk>class</jk>, <js>"mybean"</js>)
2724       *       .build();
2725       *
2726       *    <jc>// Produces:  {"_type":"mybean",...}</jc>
2727       *    String <jv>json</jv> = <jv>serializer</jv>.serialize(<jk>new</jk> MyBean());
2728       * </p>
2729       *
2730       * <ul class='notes'>
2731       *    <li class='note'>Equivalent to the {@link Bean#typeName() Bean(typeName)} annotation.
2732       * </ul>
2733       *
2734       * <ul class='seealso'>
2735       *    <li class='jc'>{@link Bean#typeName() Bean(typeName)}
2736       *    <li class='jm'>{@link BeanContext.Builder#beanDictionary(Class...)}
2737       * </ul>
2738       *
2739       * @param on
2740       *    The class the type name is being defined on.
2741       * @param value
2742       *    The new value for this setting.
2743       * @return This object.
2744       */
2745      @FluentSetter
2746      public Builder typeName(Class<?> on, String value) {
2747         bcBuilder.typeName(on, value);
2748         return this;
2749      }
2750
2751      /**
2752       * Bean type property name.
2753       *
2754       * <p>
2755       * This specifies the name of the bean property used to store the dictionary name of a bean type so that the
2756       * parser knows the data type to reconstruct.
2757       *
2758       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
2759       * <p class='bjava'>
2760       *    <jc>// POJOs with @Bean(name) annotations.</jc>
2761       *    <ja>@Bean</ja>(typeName=<js>"foo"</js>)
2762       *    <jk>public class</jk> Foo {...}
2763       *    <ja>@Bean</ja>(typeName=<js>"bar"</js>)
2764       *    <jk>public class</jk> Bar {...}
2765       *
2766       *    <jc>// Create a serializer that uses 't' instead of '_type' for dictionary names.</jc>
2767       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = JsonSerializer
2768       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
2769       *       .typePropertyName(<js>"t"</js>)
2770       *       .dictionary(Foo.<jk>class</jk>, Bar.<jk>class</jk>)
2771       *       .build();
2772       *
2773       *    <jc>// Create a serializer that uses 't' instead of '_type' for dictionary names.</jc>
2774       *    ReaderParser <jv>parser</jv> = JsonParser
2775       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
2776       *       .typePropertyName(<js>"t"</js>)
2777       *       .dictionary(Foo.<jk>class</jk>, Bar.<jk>class</jk>)
2778       *       .build();
2779       *
2780       *    <jc>// A bean with a field with an indeterminate type.</jc>
2781       *    <jk>public class</jk> MyBean {
2782       *       <jk>public</jk> Object <jf>mySimpleField</jf>;
2783       *    }
2784       *
2785       *    <jc>// Produces "{mySimpleField:{t:'foo',...}}".</jc>
2786       *    String <jv>json</jv> = <jv>serializer</jv>.serialize(<jk>new</jk> MyBean());
2787       *
2788       *    <jc>// Parse bean.</jc>
2789       *    MyBean <jv>bean</jv> = <jv>parser</jv>.parse(<jv>json</jv>, MyBean.<jk>class</jk>);
2790       * </p>
2791       *
2792       * <ul class='seealso'>
2793       *    <li class='ja'>{@link Bean#typePropertyName()}
2794       *    <li class='ja'>{@link BeanConfig#typePropertyName()}
2795       *    <li class='jm'>{@link BeanContext.Builder#typePropertyName(String)}
2796       * </ul>
2797       *
2798       * @param value
2799       *    The new value for this setting.
2800       *    <br>The default is <js>"_type"</js>.
2801       * @return This object.
2802       */
2803      @FluentSetter
2804      public Builder typePropertyName(String value) {
2805         bcBuilder.typePropertyName(value);
2806         return this;
2807      }
2808
2809      /**
2810       * Bean type property name.
2811       *
2812       * <p>
2813       * Same as {@link #typePropertyName(String)} except targets a specific bean class instead of globally.
2814       *
2815       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
2816       * <p class='bjava'>
2817       *    <jc>// POJOs with @Bean(name) annotations.</jc>
2818       *    <ja>@Bean</ja>(typeName=<js>"foo"</js>)
2819       *    <jk>public class</jk> Foo {...}
2820       *    <ja>@Bean</ja>(typeName=<js>"bar"</js>)
2821       *    <jk>public class</jk> Bar {...}
2822       *
2823       *    <jc>// A bean with a field with an indeterminate type.</jc>
2824       *    <jk>public class</jk> MyBean {
2825       *       <jk>public</jk> Object <jf>mySimpleField</jf>;
2826       *    }
2827       *
2828       *    <jc>// Create a serializer that uses 't' instead of '_type' for dictionary names.</jc>
2829       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = JsonSerializer
2830       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
2831       *       .typePropertyName(MyBean.<jk>class</jk>, <js>"t"</js>)
2832       *       .dictionary(Foo.<jk>class</jk>, Bar.<jk>class</jk>)
2833       *       .build();
2834       *
2835       *    <jc>// Produces "{mySimpleField:{t:'foo',...}}".</jc>
2836       *    String <jv>json</jv> = <jv>serializer</jv>.serialize(<jk>new</jk> MyBean());
2837       * </p>
2838       *
2839       * <ul class='seealso'>
2840       *    <li class='ja'>{@link Bean#typePropertyName() Bean(typePropertyName)}
2841       *    <li class='jm'>{@link BeanContext.Builder#typePropertyName(String)}
2842       * </ul>
2843       *
2844       * @param on The class the type property name applies to.
2845       * @param value
2846       *    The new value for this setting.
2847       *    <br>The default is <js>"_type"</js>.
2848       * @return This object.
2849       */
2850      @FluentSetter
2851      public Builder typePropertyName(Class<?> on, String value) {
2852         bcBuilder.typePropertyName(on, value);
2853         return this;
2854      }
2855
2856      /**
2857       * Use enum names.
2858       *
2859       * <p>
2860       * When enabled, enums are always serialized by name, not using {@link Object#toString()}.
2861       *
2862       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
2863       * <p class='bjava'>
2864       *    <jc>// Create a serializer with debug enabled.</jc>
2865       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = JsonSerializer
2866       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
2867       *       .useEnumNames()
2868       *       .build();
2869       *
2870       *    <jc>// Enum with overridden toString().</jc>
2871       *    <jc>// Will be serialized as ONE/TWO/THREE even though there's a toString() method.</jc>
2872       *    <jk>public enum</jk> Option {
2873       *       <jsf>ONE</jsf>(1),
2874       *       <jsf>TWO</jsf>(2),
2875       *       <jsf>THREE</jsf>(3);
2876       *
2877       *       <jk>private int</jk> <jf>value</jf>;
2878       *
2879       *       Option(<jk>int</jk> <jv>value</jv>) {
2880       *          <jk>this</jk>.<jf>value</jf> = <jv>value</jv>;
2881       *       }
2882       *
2883       *       <ja>@Override</ja>
2884       *       <jk>public</jk> String toString() {
2885       *          <jk>return</jk> String.<jsm>valueOf</jsm>(<jf>value</jf>);
2886       *       }
2887       *    }
2888       * </p>
2889       *
2890       * <ul class='seealso'>
2891       *    <li class='jm'>{@link BeanContext.Builder#useEnumNames()}
2892       * </ul>
2893       *
2894       * @return This object.
2895       */
2896      @FluentSetter
2897      public Builder useEnumNames() {
2898         bcBuilder.useEnumNames();
2899         return this;
2900      }
2901
2902      /**
2903       * Don't use interface proxies.
2904       *
2905       * <p>
2906       * When enabled, interfaces will be instantiated as proxy classes through the use of an
2907       * {@link InvocationHandler} if there is no other way of instantiating them.
2908       * Otherwise, throws a {@link BeanRuntimeException}.
2909       *
2910       * <ul class='seealso'>
2911       *    <li class='ja'>{@link BeanConfig#disableInterfaceProxies()}
2912       *    <li class='jm'>{@link BeanContext.Builder#disableInterfaceProxies()}
2913       * </ul>
2914       *
2915       * @return This object.
2916       */
2917      @FluentSetter
2918      public Builder disableInterfaceProxies() {
2919         bcBuilder.disableInterfaceProxies();
2920         return this;
2921      }
2922
2923      /**
2924       * Use Java Introspector.
2925       *
2926       * <p>
2927       * Using the built-in Java bean introspector will not pick up fields or non-standard getters/setters.
2928       * <br>Most {@link Bean @Bean} annotations will be ignored.
2929       *
2930       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
2931       * <p class='bjava'>
2932       *    <jc>// Create a serializer that only uses the built-in java bean introspector for finding properties.</jc>
2933       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = JsonSerializer
2934       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
2935       *       .useJavaBeanIntrospector()
2936       *       .build();
2937       * </p>
2938       *
2939       * <ul class='seealso'>
2940       *    <li class='jmf'>{@link BeanContext.Builder#useJavaBeanIntrospector()}
2941       * </ul>
2942       *
2943       * @return This object.
2944       */
2945      @FluentSetter
2946      public Builder useJavaBeanIntrospector() {
2947         bcBuilder.useJavaBeanIntrospector();
2948         return this;
2949      }
2950
2951      @Override /* Context.Builder */
2952      public Builder annotations(Annotation...value) {
2953         bcBuilder.annotations(value);
2954         super.annotations(value);
2955         return this;
2956      }
2957
2958      @Override /* Context.Builder */
2959      public Builder debug() {
2960         bcBuilder.debug();
2961         super.debug();
2962         return this;
2963      }

3006   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
3007   // Instance
3008   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
3009
3010   final BeanContext beanContext;
3011
3012   /**
3013    * Constructor.
3014    *
3015    * @param b The builder for this object.
3016    */
3017   protected BeanContextable(Builder b) {
3018      super(b);
3019      beanContext = b.bc != null ? b.bc : b.bcBuilder.build();
3020   }
3021
3022   /**
3023    * Returns the bean context for this object.
3024    *
3025    * @return The bean context for this object.
3026    */
3027   public BeanContext getBeanContext() {
3028      return beanContext;
3029   }
3030
3031   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
3032   // Other methods
3033   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
3034
3035   @Override /* Context */
3036   protected JsonMap properties() {
3037      return filteredMap("beanContext", beanContext.properties());
3038   }
